main event: On August 6, 1956, in Potma, USSR, there were 3-4 ball-shaped, possibly balloon-like, objects observed for 15 minutes. The event was inconclusive, with suggestions of celestial objects and insufficient data for evaluation.
interesting points: The report describes 3-4 ball-shaped, possibly balloon-like, objects observed in Potma, USSR for 15 minutes.
Possible explanations included celestial objects and insufficient data for evaluation, leading to inconclusive results.
Observers believed one sighting was a metallic, disc-shaped object at an estimated altitude of 5,000 feet, moving in a northerly direction at an estimated speed of 1,500 mph.
A friendly and reliable observer reported an unusual, rotating, silver-colored object pacing a train for several miles near Dusseldorf, Germany.
One report mentioned that the observation of unidentified objects could not be positively identified, with details refusing to make a statement about the validity of referencing.
